chronos/assets-path.description: Set a local file system path to load assets from, instead of loading them from the packaged jar.

chronos/cassandra-consistency.description: Consistency to use for Cassandra (default = ANY)

chronos/cassandra-contact-points.description: Comma separated list of contact points for Cassandra

chronos/cassandra-keyspace.description: Keyspace to use for Cassandra (default = metrics)

chronos/cassandra-table.description: Table to use for Cassandra (default = chronos)

chronos/cassandra-ttl.description: TTL for records written to Cassandra (default = 31536000)

chronos/cluster-name.description: The name of the cluster where Chronos is run

chronos/cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Chronos instance.

chronos/instances.description: Number of Chronos instances to run.

chronos/disable-after-failures.description: Disables a job after this many failures have occurred (default = 0)

chronos/failover-timeout.description: The failover timeout in seconds for Mesos (default = 604800)

chronos/graphite-host-port.description: Host and port (in the form `host:port`) for Graphite

chronos/hostname.description: The advertised hostname stored in ZooKeeper so another standby host can redirect to this elected leader (default = localhost)

chronos/http-credentials.description: Credentials for accessing the http service. If empty, anyone can access the HTTP endpoint. A username:password pair is expected where the username must not contain ':'.

chronos/http-realm.description: The security realm (aka 'area') associated with the credentials (default = Mesosphere)

chronos/id.description: Unique identifier for the app consisting of a series of names separated by slashes.

chronos/leader-max-idle-time.integer: The look-ahead time for scheduling tasks in milliseconds (default = 5000)

chronos/mail-server.description: Address of the mailserver in server:port format

chronos/mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Chronos instance.

mesos/master.description: The URL of the Mesos master. The format is a comma-delimited list of hosts like zk://host1:port,host2:port/mesos. If using ZooKeeper, pay particular attention to the leading zk:// and trailing /mesos! If not using ZooKeeper, standard URLs like http://localhost:5050 are also acceptable.

chronos/mesos-role.description: The Mesos role to run tasks under (default = *)

chronos/mesos-task-cpu.description: Number of CPUs to request from Mesos for each task (default = 0.1)

chronos/mesos-task-disk.description: Amount of disk capacity to request from Mesos for each task (MB) (default = 256.0)

chronos/mesos-task-mem.description: Amount of memory to request from Mesos for each task (MB) (default = 128.0)

chronos/raven-dsn.description: Raven DSN for connecting to a raven or sentry event service

chronos/schedule-horizon.description: The look-ahead time for scheduling tasks in seconds (default = 60)

chronos/slack-channel.description: The channel to post to in Slack

chronos/slack-token.description: Token needed for posting to Slack

chronos/slack-url.description: Webhook URL for posting to Slack

chronos/task-epsilon.description: The default epsilon value for tasks, in seconds (default = 60)

chronos/user.description: The chronos user to run the processes under (default = root)

chronos/webui-url.description: The http(s) url of the web ui, defaulting to the advertised hostname

chronos/zk-hosts.description: The list of ZooKeeper servers for storing state (default = localhost:2181)

chronos/zk-path.description: Path in ZooKeeper for storing state (default = /state)

chronos/zk-timeout.description: The timeout for ZooKeeper in milliseconds (default = 10000)
